body:
# rosegold

Minecraft client written in [Crystal](http://crystal-lang.org/), following the [botting rules](https://civwiki.org/wiki/Botting#Botting_Rules) of [CivMC](https://civwiki.org/wiki/CivMC)

## Features

- **Accurate Physics**: Movement physics that match vanilla Minecraft, including collision detection and block slipperiness
- **Full Inventory System**: Container handling, shift-clicking, equipment management, and all the inventory operations you'd expect
- **Combat & Mining**: Dig blocks with proper damage calculation, attack entities, place blocks, and handle food/eating (`dig`, `attack`, `eat!`)
- **Point-to-Point Movement**: Move directly to coordinates with jump controls and look targeting (`move_to`, `look_at`)
- **CivMC Legal**: Designed specifically to follow CivMC botting rules - no seeing/hearing violations
- **Easy to Use**: Clean API that's straightforward to learn and use
- **Cross-Platform**: Compiles to static binaries for Mac, Linux, Raspberry Pi, and Windows
- **Complete World State**: Tracks chunks, entities, player status, respawn handling, and dimensions
- **Chat & Events**: Send chat messages, subscribe to game events, comprehensive logging
- **Spectate Server**: [Headless proxy server](https://rosegoldmc.github.io/rosegold.cr/Rosegold/SpectateServer.html) for "headless with headful feel" debugging and monitoring


## How to Start Writing Bots

1. `crystal init app <nameforyourbotrepo>`
1. Add the dependency to your `shard.yml`:

   ```yaml
   dependencies:
     rosegold:
       github: grepsedawk/rosegold.cr
       version: ~> 0.7
   ```
1. Run `shards install`
1. Start with a basic example by writing a file in `src/`, something like...

   ```crystal
   require "rosegold"
   bot = Rosegold::Bot.join_game("play.civmc.net")
   sleep 3

   while bot.connected?
     bot.eat!
     bot.yaw = -90
     bot.pitch = -10
     bot.inventory.pick! "diamond_sword"
     bot.attack
     bot.wait_ticks 20
     puts bot.feet
     puts "Tool durability: #{bot.main_hand.durability} / #{bot.main_hand.max_durability}"
   end
    ```

## Contributing

1. Fork it (<https://github.com/grepsedawk/rosegold.cr/fork>)
2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`)
3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`)
4. Push to the branch (`git push origin my-new-feature`)
5. Create a new Pull Request

def.name: to_vec3d
def.body:
case self
when BlockFace::West
  Vec3d.new(-len, 0, 0)
when BlockFace::East
  Vec3d.new(len, 0, 0)
when BlockFace::Bottom
  Vec3d.new(0, -len, 0)
when BlockFace::Top
  Vec3d.new(0, len, 0)
when BlockFace::North
  Vec3d.new(0, 0, -len)
when BlockFace::South
  Vec3d.new(0, 0, len)
else
  raise("Invalid BlockFace #{self}")
end

class_methods.name: prompt_for_login!
class_methods.doc:
Prompts the user to follow Microsoft's Device Flow for OAuth.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/develop/v2-oauth2-device-code
Returns the access token as a String
class_methods.summary: Prompts the user to follow Microsoft's Device Flow for OAuth.

def.name: prompt_for_login!
def.body:
(JSON.parse((HTTP::Client.post("https://login.microsoftonline.com/consumers/oauth2/v2.0/devicecode", form: "client_id=#{CLIENT_ID}&scope=XboxLive.signin offline_access")).body)).try do |json|
  STDERR.puts(json["message"])

  loop do
    sleep(5.seconds)
    (HTTP::Client.post("https://login.microsoftonline.com/consumers/oauth2/v2.0/token", form: "client_id=#{CLIENT_ID}&scope=XboxLive.signin offline_access&code=#{json["device_code"]}&grant_type=urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:device_code")).body.try do |token_string|
      if (JSON.parse(token_string))["error"]?
        next
      end

      token = Token.from_json(token_string)
      token.expires_at = Time.local.to_unix + token.expires_in

      STDERR.puts("Login successful!")

      return token
    end
  end
end

def.name: refresh
def.body:
if expired?
  refresh!
else
  self
end

def.name: refresh!
def.body:
(HTTP::Client.post("https://login.microsoftonline.com/consumers/oauth2/v2.0/token", form: "client_id=#{CLIENT_ID}&scope=XboxLive.signin offline_access&refresh_token=#{refresh_token}&grant_type=refresh_token")).body
  .try do |json|
    (Token.from_json(json)).tap do |token|
      token.expires_at = Time.local.to_unix + token.expires_in
      token.save
    end
  end

def.name: hexdigest
def.body:
digest = Digest::SHA1.new
yield digest
big = BigInt.new((OpenSSL::BN.from_bin(digest.final)).to_dec)
if (big.bit(159)) == 1
  "-" + (((BigInt.new((big.to_s(2)).gsub({'0' => '1', '1' => '0'}), 2)) + 1).to_s(16))
else
  big.to_s(16)
end

instance_methods.name: read
instance_methods.doc:
Reads at most *slice.size* bytes from this `IO` into *slice*.
Returns the number of bytes read, which is 0 if and only if there is no
more data to read (so checking for 0 is the way to detect end of file).

```
io = IO::Memory.new "hello"
slice = Bytes.new(4)
io.read(slice) # => 4
slice          # => Bytes[104, 101, 108, 108]
io.read(slice) # => 1
slice          # => Bytes[111, 101, 108, 108]
io.read(slice) # => 0
```
instance_methods.summary: Reads at most slice.size bytes from this IO into slice.

def.name: read
def.body:
upstream_size = @io.read_fully(slice)
upstream = slice[0, upstream_size]
o = @read_cipher.update(upstream)
slice.copy_from(o)
upstream_size

```
io.write(slice)
io.to_s # => "abcd"
```

def.name: read_bit_location
def.body:
value = read_long

y = ((value << 52) >> 52).to_i32
z = ((value << 26) >> 38).to_i32
x = (value >> 38).to_i32
Rosegold::Vec3i.new(x, y, z)

def.name: read_var_int
def.body:
result = 0_u32
shift = 0
loop do
  b = read_byte
  result = result | (((127 & b).to_u32) << shift)
  if (b & 128) == 0
    return result
  end
  shift = shift + 7
  if shift >= 32
    raise("VarInt is too big: #{shift}")
  end
end

def.name: read_var_long
def.body:
result = 0_u64
shift = 0
loop do
  b = read_byte
  result = result | (((127 & b).to_u64) << shift)
  if (b & 128) == 0
    return result
  end
  shift = shift + 7
  if shift >= 64
    raise("VarLong is too big: #{shift}")
  end
end

args.name: value
args.restriction: UInt16 | Int16 | UInt32 | Int32 | UInt64 | Int64

def.body:
a = Array(UInt8).new
more = true
while more
  b = (value & 127).to_u8
  value = value >> 7
  if value == 0
    more = false
  else
    b = b | 128
  end

  a << b
end
write(a.to_unsafe.to_slice(a.size))

def.name: read
def.body:

value = Array(Int8).new(length)

length.times do
  value << io.read_byte.to_i8
end

new(value)

def.name: read
def.body:
tags = Hash(String, Tag).new

loop do
  name = ""
  tag = Tag.read(io) do |tag_type|
    if tag_type == 0
    else
      name = (StringTag.read(io)).value
    end
  end

  if tag.is_a?(EndTag)
    return new(tags)
  end

  tags[name] = tag
end

instance_methods.doc: Returns `false` (other can only be a `Value` here).

def.name: read
def.body:
list_tag_type = io.read_byte
list_length = io.read_int

tags = Array(Tag).new(list_length)

list_length.times do
  tag = Tag.read(io, list_tag_type)
  tags << tag

def.name: write
def.body:
if value.empty?
  io.write_byte(0_u8)
  io.write_full(0)
  return
end

io.write_byte(value.first.tag_type)
io.write_full(value.size.to_i32)

value.each do |tag|
  tag.write(io)
end

def.name: read_named
def.body:
name = ""
tag = Tag.read(io, tag_type) do
  if tag_type == 0
  else
    name = (StringTag.read(io)).value
  end
end

{name, tag}

def.name: read
def.body:
yield tag_type

case tag_type
when 0
  EndTag.read(io)
when 1
  ByteTag.read(io)
when 2
  ShortTag.read(io)
when 3
  IntTag.read(io)
when 4
  LongTag.read(io)
when 5
  FloatTag.read(io)
when 6
  DoubleTag.read(io)
when 7
  ByteArrayTag.read(io)
when 8
  StringTag.read(io)
when 9
  ListTag.read(io)
when 10
  CompoundTag.read(io)
when 11
  IntArrayTag.read(io)
when 12
  LongArrayTag.read(io)
else
  Log.warn do "Unsupported NBT tag type: #{tag_type}, skipping" end

  EndTag.read(io)
end

def.name: ray_intersection
def.body:
begin
  direction = end_ - start
  t_min = Vec3d.new((self.min.x - start.x) / direction.x, (self.min.y - start.y) / direction.y, (self.min.z - start.z) / direction.z)

  t_max = Vec3d.new((self.max.x - start.x) / direction.x, (self.max.y - start.y) / direction.y, (self.max.z - start.z) / direction.z)

  t_min_x, t_max_x = [t_min.x, t_max.x].min, [t_min.x, t_max.x].max
  t_min_y, t_max_y = [t_min.y, t_max.y].min, [t_min.y, t_max.y].max
  t_min_z, t_max_z = [t_min.z, t_max.z].min, [t_min.z, t_max.z].max

  t_near = [t_min_x, t_min_y, t_min_z].max
  t_far = [t_max_x, t_max_y, t_max_z].min

  if t_near > t_far
    return nil
  end
  if t_far < 0
    return nil
  end

  t_near
rescue e : ArgumentError
  nil
end

instance_methods.name: break_damage
instance_methods.args_string: (main_hand : Slot, player : Player, creative : Bool = false) : Float64
instance_methods.args_html: (main_hand : Slot, player : Player, creative : Bool = false) : Float64

def.name: break_damage
def.body:
if creative
  return 0_f64
end

speed_multiplier = 1.0
if best_tool?(main_hand)
  speed_multiplier = material_tool_multipliers[main_hand.item_id_int.to_s].as_f
  if main_hand.efficiency > 0
    speed_multiplier = speed_multiplier + ((main_hand.efficiency ** 2) + 1)
  end
end





if haste = player.effect_by_name("haste")
  speed_multiplier = speed_multiplier * (1.0 + (0.2 * (haste.amplifier + 1)))
end

if !player.on_ground?
  speed_multiplier = speed_multiplier / 5
end

damage = speed_multiplier / hardness
damage = damage / (can_harvest?(main_hand) ? 30 : 100)

if damage > 1
  return 1_f64
end

damage

def.name: break_time
def.body:
break_damage = break_damage(main_hand, player, creative)

if break_damage.zero?
  return 0
end

(1.0 / break_damage).ceil.to_i

def.name: can_harvest?
def.body:
if harvest_tools.nil?
  return true
end

(best_tool?(slot)) || harvest_tools.try do |__arg0| __arg0.keys.includes?(slot.item_id_int.to_s) end

def.name: eat!
def.body:
if food >= 15 && full_health?
  return
end
if food >= 18
  return
end

Log.info do "Eating because food is #{food} and health is #{health}" end

foods = ["carrot", "baked_potato", "bread", "beetroot", "apple", "cooked_beef", "cooked_porkchop", "cooked_chicken", "cooked_salmon", "cooked_cod", "cooked_mutton", "cooked_rabbit", "melon_slice", "dried_kelp", "pumpkin_pie", "rabbit_stew", "mushroom_stew", "beetroot_soup"]

found_food = false
foods.each do |food|
  if inventory.pick(food)
    found_food = true
    break
  end
end

if found_food
else
  raise("No edible food found in inventory. Allowed foods: #{foods.join(", ")}")
end


if main_hand.edible?
else
  Log.warn do "No edible food equipped after pick attempt" end
  return
end

start_using_hand

max_attempts = 100
attempts = 0

while !(food >= 18 || attempts >= max_attempts)
  if main_hand.edible?
  else
    break
  end
  wait_ticks(33)
  attempts = attempts + 1
end

stop_using_hand

if attempts >= max_attempts
  Log.warn do "Eating timed out after #{max_attempts} attempts, food is #{food}" end
else
  Log.info do "Eating finished, food is #{food} and health is #{health}" end
end

instance_methods.name: jump_by_height
instance_methods.doc:
Jumps and waits until the bot is `height` above the ground.
Fails if the bot lands before reaching this height.
instance_methods.summary: Jumps and waits until the bot is height above the ground.

def.name: jump_by_height
def.body:
target_y = feet.y + height
prev_y = feet.y
client.physics.jump_queued = true
timeout_ticks.times do
  wait_tick
  if feet.y >= target_y
    break
  end
  if prev_y == feet.y
    raise("Cannot jump up #{height}m at #{feet}")
  end
  prev_y = feet.y
end

instance_methods.name: land_on_ground
instance_methods.doc: Waits until the bot's y level stops changing.
instance_methods.summary: Waits until the bot's y level stops changing.

def.name: land_on_ground
def.body:
prev_y = feet.y
ticks_remaining = timeout_ticks
loop do
  wait_tick
  if prev_y == feet.y
    break
  end
  ticks_remaining = ticks_remaining - 1
  if ticks_remaining <= 0
    raise("Still falling after #{timeout_ticks} ticks")
  end
end

instance_methods.name: send_command
instance_methods.doc: Send a command with proper signing

def.name: send_command
def.body:
command_text = command.starts_with?('/') ? command[1..] : command

packet = Serverbound::ChatCommand.new(command_text)

begin
  client.send_packet!(packet)
  true
rescue e : Exception
  Log.error do "Failed to send chat command (#{e.class} - #{e.message}): #{command}" end
  false
end

instance_methods.name: send_message
instance_methods.doc: Send a regular chat message with proper signing and acknowledgment
instance_methods.summary: Send a regular chat message with proper signing and acknowledgment

def.name: send_message
def.body:
if message.bytesize > 256
  return false
end

timestamp = Time.utc.to_unix_ms
salt = Random.new.rand(Int64::MIN..Int64::MAX)
signature = nil


if has_private_key? && (key = @private_key)
  signature = generate_message_signature(message, timestamp, salt, key)
end


acknowledged = create_acknowledged_bitset


checksum = calculate_checksum(message, timestamp, salt)


packet = Serverbound::ChatMessage.new(message: message, timestamp: timestamp, salt: salt, signature: signature, message_count: @message_count, acknowledged: acknowledged, checksum: checksum)

begin
  client.send_packet!(packet)
  increment_message_index
  true
rescue e : Exception
  Log.error do "Failed to send chat message: #{e}" end
  false
end

  return nil

if section.has_only_air? && (block_state == 0_u16)

index = ((((y - min_y) & 15) << 8) | (z << 4)) | x

if previous_state == block_state
  return nil
end

previous_state

def.name: status
def.body:
io = Minecraft::IO::Wrap.new(TCPSocket.new(host, port))
connection = Connection::Client.new(io, ProtocolState::HANDSHAKING, Client.protocol_version)

connection.send_packet(Serverbound::Handshake.new(Client.protocol_version, host, port, 1))
connection.protocol_state = ProtocolState::STATUS

connection.send_packet(Serverbound::StatusRequest.new)
packet = connection.read_packet


if packet.is_a?(Clientbound::StatusResponse)
  packet
elsif packet.is_a?(Rosegold::Clientbound::RawPacket)
  Log.warn do "Received raw packet instead of StatusResponse: #{packet.bytes.inspect}" end
  Log.warn do "State: #{connection.protocol_state.name}, Protocol: #{Client.protocol_version}" end
  raise("Unexpected packet type: #{packet.class}")
else
  raise("Unexpected packet type: #{packet.class}")
end

if connected?
  raise(NotConnected.new("Already connected"))

authenticate!


detect_and_set_protocol_version

connection = @connection = Connection::Client.new(io, ProtocolState::HANDSHAKING, protocol_version, self)
@current_protocol_state = ProtocolState::HANDSHAKING
connection.handler.try(&.on(Event::Disconnected) do |_event|
  physics.handle_disconnect
end)
Log.info do "Connected to #{host}:#{port}" end

send_packet!(Serverbound::Handshake.new(protocol_version, host, port, 2))
set_protocol_state(ProtocolState::LOGIN)

queue_packet(Serverbound::LoginStart.new(player.username.not_nil!, player.uuid, protocol_version))

spawn do
  begin
    while connected?
      read_packet
    end
  rescue e : IO::Error
    Log.debug do "Stopping reader: #{e}" end
  end
end

def.name: start_ticker
def.body:
spawn do
  target_interval_ns = 50000000_u64
  tick_counter = 0_u64

  start_time_ns = Time.monotonic.total_nanoseconds.to_u64

  loop do
    if connected?
    else
      break
    end

    target_tick_time_ns = start_time_ns + (tick_counter * target_interval_ns)
    current_time_ns = Time.monotonic.total_nanoseconds.to_u64

    if current_time_ns < target_tick_time_ns
      sleep_ns = target_tick_time_ns - current_time_ns

      if sleep_ns > 1000000
        rough_sleep_ns = sleep_ns - 500000
        sleep(Time::Span.new(nanoseconds: rough_sleep_ns.to_i64))

        while Time.monotonic.total_nanoseconds.to_u64 < target_tick_time_ns
          Fiber.yield
        end
      else
        while Time.monotonic.total_nanoseconds.to_u64 < target_tick_time_ns
          Fiber.yield
        end
      end
    end

    should_tick = if @ticking_frozen
      if @pending_tick_steps > 0
        @pending_tick_steps = @pending_tick_steps - 1
        true
      else
        false
      end
    else
      true
    end

    if should_tick
      interactions.tick
      physics.tick
      emit_event(Event::Tick.new)
    end

    tick_counter = tick_counter + 1

    if (tick_counter % 100) == 0
      actual_time_ns = Time.monotonic.total_nanoseconds.to_u64
      expected_time_ns = start_time_ns + (tick_counter * target_interval_ns)
      drift_ms = (actual_time_ns.to_i64 - expected_time_ns.to_i64) / 1000000.0
      Log.trace do "Tick #{tick_counter}: drift #{drift_ms.round(2)}ms" end
    end
  end
end

def.name: transfer_to
def.body:
Log.info do "Initiating transfer to #{new_host}:#{new_port}" end

old_connection = @connection
old_host = @host
old_port = @port

Log.debug do "Preserving #{@cookies.size} cookies for transfer" end

old_connection.try do |conn|
  if conn.open?
    Log.debug do "Disconnecting from current server for transfer" end
    conn.disconnect("Transferring to #{new_host}:#{new_port}")
  end
end

@host = new_host
@port = new_port.to_i
@connection = nil
@current_protocol_state = ProtocolState::HANDSHAKING

begin
  Log.info do "Connecting to new server #{new_host}:#{new_port}" end
  connect
  Log.info do "Transfer to #{new_host}:#{new_port} completed successfully" end
rescue e
  Log.error do "Transfer failed during connection to #{new_host}:#{new_port}: #{e.message}" end
  @host = old_host
  @port = old_port
  @connection = nil
  raise(e)
end

def.name: callback
def.body:
start_time = client.chunk_batch_start_time
if start_time
else
  return
end

end_time = Time.utc
duration_ms = (end_time - start_time).total_milliseconds


millis_per_chunk = batch_size > 0 ? duration_ms / batch_size : 0.0


client.add_chunk_batch_sample(millis_per_chunk, batch_size)



chunks_per_tick = millis_per_chunk > 0 ? 25.0 / millis_per_chunk : 25.0


client.send_packet!(Rosegold::Serverbound::ChunkBatchReceived.new(chunks_per_tick.to_f32))


client.chunk_batch_start_time = nil

def.name: read
def.body:
chunk_x = io.read_int
chunk_z = io.read_int


heightmaps_count = io.read_var_int
heightmaps = Array(Heightmap).new(heightmaps_count) do Heightmap.read(io) end


data = io.read_var_bytes


block_entities_count = io.read_var_int
block_entities = Array(Chunk::BlockEntity).new(block_entities_count) do
  xz = io.read_byte
  Chunk::BlockEntity.new((chunk_x * 16) + ((xz >> 4) & 15), io.read_short, (chunk_z * 16) + (xz & 15), io.read_var_int, io.read_nbt_unamed)
end


light_data = io.getb_to_end

self.new(chunk_x, chunk_z, heightmaps, data, block_entities, light_data)

def.name: new
def.body:
heightmaps = convert_nbt_to_heightmaps(chunk.heightmaps)
light_data = chunk.light_data
self.new(chunk.x, chunk.z, heightmaps, chunk.data, chunk.block_entities, light_data)

def.name: callback
def.body:
source = Minecraft::IO::Memory.new(data)
chunk = Chunk.new(chunk_x, chunk_z, source, client.dimension)
chunk.block_entities = block_entities

chunk.heightmaps = convert_heightmaps_to_nbt(heightmaps)
chunk.light_data = light_data
client.dimension.load_chunk(chunk)

if client.physics.paused?
  spawn_chunk_x = client.player.feet.x.to_i >> 4
  spawn_chunk_z = client.player.feet.z.to_i >> 4
  if (chunk_x == spawn_chunk_x) && (chunk_z == spawn_chunk_z)
    client.physics.unpause_for_spawn_chunk
    Log.debug do "Spawn chunk loaded - physics unpaused" end
  end
end

def.name: write
def.body:
Minecraft::IO::Memory.new.tap do |io|
  io.write(self.class.packet_id_for_protocol(Client.protocol_version))
  io.write_full(chunk_x)
  io.write_full(chunk_z)


  io.write(heightmaps.size)
  heightmaps.each(&.write(io))


  io.write(data.size)
  io.write(data)


  io.write(block_entities.size)
  block_entities.each do |block_entity|


    chunk_world_x = chunk_x * 16
    chunk_world_z = chunk_z * 16
    relative_x = block_entity.x - chunk_world_x
    relative_z = block_entity.z - chunk_world_z
    io.write((((relative_x & 15) << 4) | (relative_z & 15)).to_u8)
    io.write_full(block_entity.y.to_i16)
    io.write(block_entity.type)

    if block_entity.nbt.is_a?(Minecraft::NBT::CompoundTag)
      io.write_byte(10_u8)

      (block_entity.nbt.as(Minecraft::NBT::CompoundTag)).write(io)
    else
      io.write(block_entity.nbt)
    end
  end


  io.write(light_data)
end.to_slice

def.name: callback
def.body:
if client.container_menu && (window_id == client.container_menu.id)
  Log.debug do "Server closed container #{client.container_menu}" end
  client.container_menu.handle_close
elsif window_id == 0
  Log.debug do "Server requested close of player inventory (ignored)" end
else
  container_id = client.container_menu.try(&.id) || "nil"
  Log.warn do "Server closed unknown window: #{window_id}. Current container: #{container_id}. Ignoring." end
  Log.debug do self end
end

def.name: read
def.body:
nbt_type = packet.read_byte

message = if nbt_type == 8
  text = packet.read_var_string
  Rosegold::Chat.new(text)
else
  Rosegold::Chat.new("Complex text component")
end


chat_type_id = packet.read_var_int.to_u32
if chat_type_id == 0
  packet.read_var_string

  param_count = packet.read_var_int
  param_count.times do
    packet.read_var_int
  end

  style_nbt_type = packet.read_byte
  if style_nbt_type != 0
  end
end


sender_nbt_type = packet.read_byte
sender_name = if sender_nbt_type == 8
  text = packet.read_var_string
  Rosegold::Chat.new(text)
else
  Rosegold::Chat.new("Server")
end


target_name = nil
if packet.read_bool
  target_nbt_type = packet.read_byte
  target_name = if target_nbt_type == 8
    text = packet.read_var_string
    Rosegold::Chat.new(text)
  else
    Rosegold::Chat.new("Target")
  end
end

self.new(message, chat_type_id, sender_name, target_name)

def.name: new
def.body:

def.name: write
def.body:
Minecraft::IO::Memory.new.tap do |buffer|
  buffer.write(self.class.packet_id_for_protocol(Client.protocol_version))
  buffer.write(message.to_json)
  buffer.write(chat_type)
  buffer.write(sender_name.to_json)
  if target = target_name
    buffer.write(true)
    buffer.write(target.to_json)
  else
    buffer.write(false)
  end
end.to_slice

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (entity_id : UInt64, effect_id : UInt32, amplifier : UInt8, duration : UInt32, flags : UInt8)
constructors.args_html: (entity_id : UInt64, effect_id : UInt32, amplifier : UInt8, duration : UInt32, flags : UInt8)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(entity_id, effect_id, amplifier, duration, flags)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

def.name: callback
def.body:
entity = client.dimension.entities[entity_id]?
effect = Rosegold::EntityEffect.new(effect_id, amplifier, duration, flags)

if client.player.entity_id == entity_id
  if existing_effect = client.player.effects.find do |active_effect| active_effect.effect == effect.effect end
    existing_effect.amplifier = amplifier
    existing_effect.duration = duration
    existing_effect.flags = flags
    return
  end

  client.player.effects << effect
end

if entity.nil?
  Log.warn do "Received entity effect packet for unknown entity ID #{entity_id}" end
  return
end

if existing_effect = entity.effects.find do |active_effect| active_effect.effect == effect.effect end
  existing_effect.amplifier = amplifier
  existing_effect.duration = duration
  existing_effect.flags = flags
  return
end

entity.effects << effect

def.body:
Minecraft::IO::Memory.new.tap do |buffer|
  buffer.write(self.class.packet_id_for_protocol(Client.protocol_version))
  buffer.write(entity_id)
  buffer.write(effect_id)
  buffer.write(amplifier)
  buffer.write(duration)
  buffer.write(flags)
end.to_slice

def.name: valid?
def.body:
slots = [main_hand, off_hand, boots, leggings, chestplate, helmet]
  .select(&.try(&.present?))
!slots.empty?

def.name: write
def.body:
slots = [main_hand, off_hand, boots, leggings, chestplate, helmet]
  .map_with_index do |slot, i| {slot, i.to_u8} end
  .select do |slot, _| slot && slot.present? end
if slots.empty?
  raise("Cannot write empty EntityEquipment")
end
_, last_i = slots.last
Minecraft::IO::Memory.new.tap do |buffer|
  buffer.write(self.class.packet_id_for_protocol(Client.protocol_version))
  buffer.write(entity_id)
  slots.each do |slot, i|
    if i == last_i
    else
      i = i | 128
    end
    buffer.write(i)
    buffer.write(slot.not_nil!)
  end
end.to_slice

def.name: callback
def.body:
Log.debug do "Game event: #{event} value: #{value}" end

case event
when 0_u8
  Log.debug do "No respawn block available" end
when 1_u8
  Log.debug do "Begin raining" end
when 2_u8
  Log.debug do "End raining" end
when 3_u8
  Log.debug do "Change game mode to #{value.to_i}" end
when 4_u8
  Log.debug do "Win game - show credits" end
when 5_u8
  Log.debug do "Demo event - #{value}" end
when 6_u8
  Log.debug do "Arrow hit player" end
when 7_u8
  Log.debug do "Rain level change: #{value}" end
when 8_u8
  Log.debug do "Thunder level change: #{value}" end
when 9_u8
  Log.debug do "Play pufferfish sting sound" end
when 10_u8
  Log.debug do "Play elder guardian mob appearance" end
when 11_u8
  Log.debug do "Enable respawn screen: #{value == 0.0 ? "immediate" : "show screen"}" end
when 12_u8
  Log.debug do "Limited crafting: #{value == 1.0 ? "enabled" : "disabled"}" end
when 13_u8
  Log.debug do "Start waiting for level chunks" end
else
  Log.debug do "Unknown game event: #{event}" end
end

def.name: read
def.body:
pack_count = packet.read_var_int


known_packs = Array(NamedTuple(namespace: String, id: String, version: String)).new(pack_count) do
  namespace = packet.read_var_string
  id = packet.read_var_string
  version = packet.read_var_string
  {namespace: namespace, id: id, version: version}
end

self.new(known_packs)

def.name: callback
def.body:
Log.debug do "Received known packs from server: #{known_packs.size} packs" end


client.known_packs = known_packs.dup
Log.trace do "Stored #{known_packs.size} known packs in client" end


response = Rosegold::Serverbound::KnownPacks.new(known_packs)
client.send_packet!(response)

def.name: write
def.body:
Minecraft::IO::Memory.new.tap do |buffer|
  buffer.write(self.class.packet_id_for_protocol(Client.protocol_version))
  buffer.write(known_packs.size)
  known_packs.each do |pack|
    buffer.write(pack[:namespace])
    buffer.write(pack[:id])
    buffer.write(pack[:version])
  end

def.name: read
def.body:
entity_id = io.read_int

hardcore = io.read_bool

dim_count = io.read_var_int

dimension_names = Array(String).new(dim_count) do |_|
  io.read_var_string
end

max_players = io.read_var_int
view_distance = io.read_var_int
simulation_distance = io.read_var_int
reduced_debug_info = io.read_bool
enable_respawn_screen = io.read_bool
do_limited_crafting = io.read_bool
dimension_type = io.read_var_int
dimension_name = io.read_var_string
hashed_seed = io.read_long
gamemode = io.read_byte
previous_gamemode = io.read_signed_byte
is_debug = io.read_bool
is_flat = io.read_bool
has_death_location = io.read_bool

death_dimension_name = nil
death_location = nil
if has_death_location
  death_dimension_name = io.read_var_string
  death_location = io.read_bit_location
end

portal_cooldown = io.read_var_int
sea_level = io.read_var_int
enforces_secure_chat = io.read_bool

self.new(entity_id, hardcore, dimension_names, max_players, view_distance, simulation_distance, reduced_debug_info, enable_respawn_screen, do_limited_crafting, dimension_type, dimension_name, hashed_seed, gamemode, previous_gamemode, is_debug, is_flat, has_death_location, death_dimension_name, death_location, portal_cooldown, sea_level, enforces_secure_chat)

def.name: callback
def.body:
client.player.entity_id = entity_id.to_u64
client.player.gamemode = gamemode.to_i8



client.dimension = Dimension.for_dimension_name(dimension_name)

Log.debug do "Ingame. #{dimension_name} gamemode=#{gamemode} entity_id=#{entity_id}" end

def.name: write
def.body:
Minecraft::IO::Memory.new.tap do |buffer|
  buffer.write(self.class.packet_id_for_protocol(Client.protocol_version))
  buffer.write_full(entity_id)
  buffer.write(hardcore?)
  buffer.write(dimension_names.size)
  dimension_names.each do |name| buffer.write(name) end
  buffer.write(max_players)
  buffer.write(view_distance)
  buffer.write(simulation_distance)
  buffer.write(reduced_debug_info?)
  buffer.write(enable_respawn_screen?)
  buffer.write(do_limited_crafting?)
  buffer.write(dimension_type)
  buffer.write(dimension_name)
  buffer.write_full(hashed_seed)
  buffer.write(gamemode)
  buffer.write(previous_gamemode)
  buffer.write(is_debug?)
  buffer.write(is_flat?)
  buffer.write(has_death_location?)
  if has_death_location?
    buffer.write(death_dimension_name.not_nil!)
    buffer.write(death_location.not_nil!)
  end
  buffer.write(portal_cooldown)
  buffer.write(sea_level)
  buffer.write(enforces_secure_chat?)
end.to_slice

def.name: write
def.body:
Minecraft::IO::Memory.new.tap do |buffer|

  buffer.write(self.class.packet_id_for_protocol(Client.protocol_version))
  buffer.write(uuid)
  buffer.write(username)


  buffer.write(properties.size)
  properties.each do |prop|
    buffer.write(prop.name)
    buffer.write(prop.value)
    if signature = prop.signature

    else
      buffer.write(false)
    end
  end
end.to_slice

def.name: read
def.body:
section_pos_bits = packet.read_long

section_y = ((section_pos_bits << 44) >> 44).to_i32
section_z = ((section_pos_bits << 22) >> 42).to_i32
section_x = (section_pos_bits >> 42).to_i32

block_states = Array(Tuple(Int32, Int32, Int32, UInt16)).new(packet.read_var_int) do
  long = packet.read_var_long


  rel_y = (long & 15).to_i32
  rel_z = ((long >> 4) & 15).to_i32
  rel_x = ((long >> 8) & 15).to_i32


  x = (section_x * 16) + rel_x
  y = (section_y * 16) + rel_y
  z = (section_z * 16) + rel_z

  block_state = (long >> 12).to_u16
  {x, y, z, block_state}
end

self.new(section_x, section_y, section_z, block_states)

def.name: read
def.body:
global_index = packet.read_var_int.to_u32
sender = packet.read_uuid
index = packet.read_var_int.to_u32


signature = nil
if packet.read_bool
  signature = Bytes.new(256)
  packet.read_fully(signature)
end


message = packet.read_var_string
timestamp = packet.read_long
salt = packet.read_long


previous_count = packet.read_var_int
previous_messages = Array(Bytes).new(previous_count)
previous_count.times do
  message_id = packet.read_var_int
  msg_signature = if packet.read_bool
    sig = Bytes.new(256)
    packet.read_fully(sig)
    sig
  else
    Bytes.empty
  end
  if msg_signature.empty?
  else
    previous_messages << msg_signature
  end
end


unsigned_content = nil
if packet.read_bool
  unsigned_content = Rosegold::Chat.from_json(packet.read_var_string)
end


filter_type = packet.read_var_int.to_u32
filter_mask = nil
if filter_type == 2_u32
  mask_size = (message.bytesize + 7) // 8
  filter_mask = Bytes.new(mask_size)
  packet.read_fully(filter_mask)
end


chat_type = packet.read_var_int.to_u32
network_name = Rosegold::Chat.from_json(packet.read_var_string)
network_target_name = nil
if packet.read_bool
  network_target_name = Rosegold::Chat.from_json(packet.read_var_string)
end

self.new(global_index, sender, index, signature, message, timestamp, salt, previous_messages, unsigned_content, filter_type, filter_mask, chat_type, network_name, network_target_name)

constructors.args_html: (global_index : UInt32, sender : UUID, index : UInt32, signature : Slice(UInt8) | Nil, message : String, timestamp : Int64, salt : Int64, previous_messages : Array(Slice(UInt8)), unsigned_content : Nil | Rosegold::Chat, filter_type : UInt32, filter_mask : Slice(UInt8) | Nil, chat_type : UInt32, network_name : Rosegold::Chat, network_target_name : Nil | Rosegold::Chat)

def.name: callback
def.body:
Log.info do "[CHAT] #{network_name}: #{message}" end


if sig = signature
  client.chat_manager.add_last_seen_signature(sig)
end
client.chat_manager.increment_message_count

def.name: write
def.body:
Minecraft::IO::Memory.new.tap do |buffer|
  buffer.write(self.class.packet_id_for_protocol(Client.protocol_version))


  buffer.write(global_index)
  buffer.write(sender)
  buffer.write(index)


  if sig = signature
    buffer.write(true)
    buffer.write(sig)
  else
    buffer.write(false)
  end


  buffer.write(message)
  buffer.write_full(timestamp)
  buffer.write_full(salt)


  buffer.write(previous_messages.size.to_u32)
  previous_messages.each do |msg_sig|
    buffer.write(0_u32)
    if msg_sig.size > 0
      buffer.write(true)
      buffer.write(msg_sig)
    else
      buffer.write(false)
    end
  end


  if unsigned = unsigned_content
    buffer.write(true)
    buffer.write(unsigned.to_json)
  else
    buffer.write(false)
  end


  buffer.write(filter_type)
  if mask = filter_mask
    buffer.write(mask)
  end


  buffer.write(chat_type)
  buffer.write(network_name.to_json)
  if target = network_target_name
    buffer.write(true)
    buffer.write(target.to_json)
  else
    buffer.write(false)
  end
end.to_slice

def.name: read
def.body:
actions = packet.read_byte
player_count = packet.read_var_int

players = Array(PlayerEntry).new(player_count.to_i32) do |_|
  uuid = packet.read_uuid


  name = nil
  properties = nil
  if (actions & ADD_PLAYER) != 0
    name = packet.read_var_string
    prop_count = packet.read_var_int
    properties = Array(PlayerEntry::Property).new(prop_count.to_i32) do |_|
      prop_name = packet.read_var_string
      prop_value = packet.read_var_string
      has_signature = packet.read_bool
      prop_signature = has_signature ? packet.read_var_string : nil
      PlayerEntry::Property.new(prop_name, prop_value, prop_signature)
    end
  end


  chat_session_id = nil
  public_key_expiry_time = nil
  encoded_public_key = nil
  public_key_signature = nil
  if (actions & INITIALIZE_CHAT) != 0
    has_chat_session = packet.read_bool
    if has_chat_session
      chat_session_id = packet.read_uuid
      public_key_expiry_time = packet.read_long
      key_length = packet.read_var_int
      encoded_public_key = Bytes.new(key_length.to_i32)
      packet.read(encoded_public_key)
      sig_length = packet.read_var_int
      public_key_signature = Bytes.new(sig_length.to_i32)
      packet.read(public_key_signature)
    end
  end

  gamemode = (actions & UPDATE_GAMEMODE) != 0 ? packet.read_var_int.to_i32 : nil
  listed = (actions & UPDATE_LISTED) != 0 ? packet.read_bool : nil
  latency = (actions & UPDATE_LATENCY) != 0 ? packet.read_var_int.to_i32 : nil

  display_name = nil
  if (actions & UPDATE_DISPLAY_NAME) != 0
    has_display_name = packet.read_bool
    display_name = has_display_name ? Rosegold::TextComponent.read(packet) : nil
  end

  list_priority = (actions & UPDATE_LIST_PRIORITY) != 0 ? packet.read_var_int.to_i32 : nil
  hat_visible = (actions & UPDATE_HAT) != 0 ? packet.read_bool : nil

  PlayerEntry.new(uuid, name, properties, chat_session_id, public_key_expiry_time, encoded_public_key, public_key_signature, gamemode, listed, latency, display_name, list_priority, hat_visible)
end

self.new(actions, players)

def.name: callback
def.body:
Log.debug do "Player info update: actions=0x#{(actions.to_s(16)).upcase.rjust(2, '0')}, #{players.size} players" end
players.each do |player|

  entry = client.player_list[player.uuid]? || (Rosegold::PlayerList::Entry.new(player.uuid))


  if (actions & ADD_PLAYER) != 0
    entry.name = player.name
    if props = player.properties
      entry.properties = props.map do |prop|
        Rosegold::PlayerList::Property.new(prop.name, prop.value, prop.signature)
      end
    end
    Log.debug do "  Added player: #{player.name} (#{player.uuid})" end
  end

  if (actions & UPDATE_GAMEMODE) != 0
    entry.gamemode = player.gamemode.try(&.to_i8)
  end

  if (actions & UPDATE_LATENCY) != 0
    entry.ping = player.latency.try(&.to_u32)
  end

  if (actions & UPDATE_DISPLAY_NAME) != 0
    entry.display_name = player.display_name
  end


  client.player_list[player.uuid] = entry
end

def.name: write
def.body:
Minecraft::IO::Memory.new.tap do |buffer|
  buffer.write(self.class.packet_id_for_protocol(Client.protocol_version))
  buffer.write(actions)
  buffer.write(players.size)

  players.each do |player|
    buffer.write(player.uuid)


    if (actions & ADD_PLAYER) != 0
      buffer.write(player.name.not_nil!)
      if props = player.properties
        buffer.write(props.size)
        props.each do |prop|
          buffer.write(prop.name)
          buffer.write(prop.value)
          if sig = prop.signature
            buffer.write(true)
            buffer.write(sig)
          else
            buffer.write(false)
          end
        end
      else
        buffer.write(0_u32)
      end
    end

    if (actions & INITIALIZE_CHAT) != 0
      if chat_session_id = player.chat_session_id
        buffer.write(true)
        buffer.write(chat_session_id)


        buffer.write_full(player.public_key_expiry_time.not_nil!)
        buffer.write(player.encoded_public_key.not_nil!.size)
        buffer.write(player.encoded_public_key.not_nil!)
        buffer.write(player.public_key_signature.not_nil!.size)
        buffer.write(player.public_key_signature.not_nil!)
      else
        buffer.write(false)
      end
    end

    if (actions & UPDATE_GAMEMODE) != 0
      buffer.write(player.gamemode.not_nil!)
    end

    if (actions & UPDATE_LISTED) != 0
      buffer.write(player.listed.not_nil!)
    end

    if (actions & UPDATE_LATENCY) != 0
      buffer.write(player.latency.not_nil!)
    end

    if (actions & UPDATE_DISPLAY_NAME) != 0
      if display_name = player.display_name
        buffer.write(true)
        buffer.write(display_name)
      else
        buffer.write(false)
      end
    end

    if (actions & UPDATE_LIST_PRIORITY) != 0
      buffer.write(player.list_priority.not_nil!)
    end

    if (actions & UPDATE_HAT) != 0
      buffer.write(player.hat_visible.not_nil!)
    end
  end
end.to_slice

def.body:

def.name: write
def.body:
Minecraft::IO::Memory.new.tap do |buffer|
  buffer.write(self.class.packet_id_for_protocol(Client.protocol_version))
  buffer.write(registry_id)
  buffer.write(entries.size)
  entries.each do |entry|
    buffer.write(entry[:id])
    if data = entry[:data]
      buffer.write(true)
      buffer.write(data)
    else
      buffer.write(false)
    end
  end
end.to_slice

def.name: callback
def.body:
entity = client.dimension.entities[entity_id]?

if client.player.entity_id == entity_id
  client.player.effects = client.player.effects.reject do |effect| effect.id == effect_id end
  return
end

if entity.nil?
  Log.warn do "Received RemoveEntityEffect packet for unknown entity ID #{entity_id}" end
  return
end

entity.effects = entity.effects.reject do |effect| effect.id == effect_id end

def.name: callback
def.body:
client.physics.pause
client.player.gamemode = gamemode.to_i8



client.dimension = Dimension.for_dimension_name(dimension_name)

Log.debug do "Respawned in #{dimension_name} gamemode=#{gamemode} dimension_type=#{dimension_type}" end

def.name: write
def.body:
Minecraft::IO::Memory.new.tap do |buffer|
  buffer.write(self.class.packet_id_for_protocol(Client.protocol_version))
  buffer.write(dimension_type)
  buffer.write(dimension_name)
  buffer.write_full(hashed_seed)
  buffer.write(gamemode)
  buffer.write(previous_gamemode)
  buffer.write(is_debug?)
  buffer.write(is_flat?)
  buffer.write(has_death_location?)

  if has_death_location?
    if death_dim_name = death_dimension_name
      buffer.write(death_dim_name)
    end
    if death_loc = death_location
      buffer.write(death_loc)
    end
  end

  buffer.write(portal_cooldown)
  buffer.write(sea_level)
  buffer.write(data_kept)
end.to_slice

def.name: callback
def.body:
Log.debug do "Received #{slots.size} container content for window #{window_id} state #{state_id}" end

if window_id == 0
  slot_array = slots.map() do |__arg0| __arg0.as(Rosegold::Slot) end
  client.inventory_menu.update_all_slots(slot_array, cursor.as(Rosegold::Slot), state_id)
elsif client.container_menu && (client.container_menu.id == window_id)
  slot_array = slots.map() do |__arg1| __arg1.as(Rosegold::Slot) end
  client.container_menu.update_all_slots(slot_array, cursor.as(Rosegold::Slot), state_id)
else
  container_id = client.container_menu.try(&.id) || "nil"
  Log.debug do "Ignoring SetContainerContent for mismatched window. Packet window_id=#{window_id}, client container_id=#{container_id}" end
end

def.name: write
def.body:
Minecraft::IO::Memory.new.tap do |buffer|
  buffer.write(self.class.packet_id_for_protocol(Client.protocol_version))
  buffer.write(window_id)
  buffer.write(state_id)
  buffer.write(slots.size.to_u32)
  slots.each do |slot|
    slot.write(buffer)
  end
  cursor.write(buffer)
end.to_slice

def.name: callback
def.body:
if (window_id == -1) && (slot.slot_number == -1)
  client.container_menu.cursor = slot.as(Rosegold::Slot)
elsif window_id == 0
  client.inventory_menu.update_slot(slot.slot_number, slot.as(Rosegold::Slot), state_id)
elsif client.container_menu && (client.container_menu.id == window_id)
  client.container_menu.update_slot(slot.slot_number, slot.as(Rosegold::Slot), state_id)
else
  container_id = client.container_menu.try(&.id) || "nil"
  Log.debug do "Received slot update for an unknown or mismatched window. Ignoring. Packet window_id=#{window_id}, client container_id=#{container_id}, slot=#{slot}" end
  Log.debug do self end
end

def.body:
teleport_id = packet.read_var_int
x = packet.read_double
y = packet.read_double
z = packet.read_double
velocity_x = packet.read_double
velocity_y = packet.read_double
velocity_z = packet.read_double
yaw = packet.read_float
pitch = packet.read_float
relative_flags = packet.read_byte


dismount_vehicle = packet.read_byte != 0_u8


extra_byte1 = packet.read_byte
extra_byte2 = packet.read_byte
Log.debug do "SynchronizePlayerPosition extra bytes: #{extra_byte1.to_s(16)} #{extra_byte2.to_s(16)}" end

self.new(x, y, z, yaw, pitch, relative_flags, teleport_id, dismount_vehicle, velocity_x, velocity_y, velocity_z)

def.name: callback
def.body:
player = client.player
player.feet = feet(player.feet)
player.look = look(player.look)


player.velocity = Vec3d.new(velocity_x, velocity_y, velocity_z)

client.queue_packet(Serverbound::TeleportConfirm.new(teleport_id))


client.emit_event(Event::PlayerPositionUpdate.new(player.feet, player.look))

Log.debug do "Position synchronized: #{player.feet} #{player.look} flags=#{relative_flags}" end

client.physics.handle_reset

def.name: feet
def.body:
x = sanitize_coordinate(x_raw, -30000000.0, 30000000.0)
y = sanitize_coordinate(y_raw, -20000000.0, 20000000.0)
z = sanitize_coordinate(z_raw, -30000000.0, 30000000.0)

if (relative_flags & 1) != 0
  x = x + previous_feet.x
end
if (relative_flags & 2) != 0
  y = y + previous_feet.y
end
if (relative_flags & 4) != 0
  z = z + previous_feet.z
end

Vec3d.new(x, y, z)

def.name: look
def.body:
yaw = yaw_raw
pitch = pitch_raw

if (relative_flags & 8) != 0
  yaw = yaw + previous_look.yaw
end
if (relative_flags & 16) != 0
  pitch = pitch + previous_look.pitch
end

Look.new(yaw, pitch)

  message = packet.read_text_component
rescue ex
  Log.warn do "Failed to parse system chat content as NBT: #{ex.message}, trying as string" end
  content_string = begin
    packet.read_var_string

  message = TextComponent.new(content_string)
end


overlay = packet.read_bool

self.new(message, overlay)

tag_types = Array(TagType).new(type_count) do
  type_name = packet.read_var_string

  tags = Array(NamedTuple(name: String, entries: Array(UInt32))).new(tag_count) do

def.name: write
def.body:
Minecraft::IO::Memory.new.tap do |buffer|
  buffer.write(self.class.packet_id_for_protocol(Client.protocol_version))
  buffer.write(tag_types.size)
  tag_types.each do |tag_type|
    buffer.write(tag_type[:type])
    buffer.write(tag_type[:tags].size)
    tag_type[:tags].each do |tag|
      buffer.write(tag[:name])
      buffer.write(tag[:entries].size)
      tag[:entries].each do |entry|
        buffer.write(entry)
      end
    end
  end
end.to_slice

types.name: Config
types.doc:
Manages configuration files in the XDG Base Directory Specification directories.

For each application, a subdirectory is created in the config directory that stores
configuration files specific to the application.

On Linux and other Unix-like systems, the XDG Base Directory Specification is used
to determine the location of the configuration directory. On Windows, the %LOCALAPPDATA%
environment variable is used instead.

class_methods.name: decode_clientbound_packet
class_methods.doc: Protocol-aware packet decoding for clientbound packets
class_methods.summary: Protocol-aware packet decoding for clientbound packets
class_methods.args_string: (packet_bytes : Bytes, protocol_state : ProtocolState, protocol_version : UInt32) : Clientbound::Packet

def.name: decode_clientbound_packet
def.body:
(Minecraft::IO::Memory.new(packet_bytes)).try do |pkt_io|
  pkt_id = pkt_io.read_byte || (raise("Empty packet"))

  pkt_type = protocol_state.get_clientbound_packet(pkt_id, protocol_version)


  if log_packet_ids = ENV["LOG_PACKET"]?
    packet_ids_to_log = (log_packet_ids.split(",")).compact_map do |id_str|
      cleaned = id_str.strip
      if (cleaned.starts_with?("0x")) || (cleaned.starts_with?("0X"))
        cleaned[2..].to_u8?(16)
      else
        cleaned.to_u8?
      end
    end

    if packet_ids_to_log.includes?(pkt_id)
      packet_name = pkt_type ? pkt_type.name : "Unknown (0x#{(pkt_id.to_s(16)).upcase})"
      packet_hex = "0x#{(pkt_id.to_s(16)).upcase.rjust(2, '0')}"
      Log.warn do "Logged packet #{packet_name} (#{packet_hex}) in #{protocol_state.name} state for protocol #{protocol_version}" end
      Log.warn do "Packet bytes (#{packet_bytes.size} bytes): #{packet_bytes.hexstring}" end
    end
  end

  if pkt_type && (pkt_type.responds_to?(:read))
  else
    return Clientbound::RawPacket.new(packet_bytes)
  end

  begin
    result = pkt_type.read(pkt_io)
    result
  rescue ex
    packet_name = pkt_type.name
    packet_hex = "0x#{(pkt_id.to_s(16)).upcase.rjust(2, '0')}"

    Log.warn do "Failed to parse clientbound packet #{packet_name} (#{packet_hex}) in #{protocol_state.name} state for protocol #{protocol_version}: #{ex.message}" end
    Log.warn do "Packet bytes (#{packet_bytes.size} bytes): #{packet_bytes.hexstring}" end
    Log.warn do "Exception: #{ex.class}: #{ex.message}" end
    Log.warn do "Stack trace:\n#{ex.backtrace?.try(&.join("\n")) || "No backtrace available"}" end


    Clientbound::RawPacket.new(packet_bytes)
  end
end

class_methods.doc: Protocol-aware packet decoding for serverbound packets

def.name: decode_serverbound_packet
def.body:
(Minecraft::IO::Memory.new(packet_bytes)).try do |pkt_io|
  pkt_id = pkt_io.read_byte || (raise("Empty packet"))

  pkt_type = protocol_state.get_serverbound_packet(pkt_id, protocol_version)

  if pkt_type && (pkt_type.responds_to?(:read))
  else
    return Serverbound::RawPacket.new(packet_bytes)
  end
  pkt_type.read(pkt_io)
end

def.name: disconnect
def.body:
text_component = TextComponent.new(reason)
Log.info do "Disconnected: #{text_component}" end
@close_reason = text_component
io.close
handler.try(&.emit_event(Event::Disconnected.new(text_component)))

def.name: io=
def.body:
read_mutex.synchronize do
  write_mutex.synchronize do
    @io = io
  end
end

def.name: read_raw_packet
def.body:
begin
  if close_reason
    raise(Rosegold::Client::NotConnected.new)
  end

  packet_bytes = Bytes.new(0)
  read_mutex.synchronize do
    if compress?
      frame_len = io.read_var_int
      io.read_fully(frame_bytes = Bytes.new(frame_len))

      frame_io = Minecraft::IO::Memory.new(frame_bytes)
      uncompressed_data_len = frame_io.read_var_int
      if uncompressed_data_len == 0
        uncompressed_data_len = frame_len - 1
      else
        frame_io = Compress::Zlib::Reader.new(frame_io)
      end
      frame_io.read_fully(packet_bytes = Bytes.new(uncompressed_data_len))
    else
      io.read_fully(packet_bytes = Bytes.new(io.read_var_int))
    end
  end
  packet_bytes
rescue e
  disconnect("IO Error: #{e.message}")
  raise_without_backtrace(e)
end

def.name: send_packet
def.body:
begin
  if close_reason
    raise(Rosegold::Client::NotConnected.new)
  end

  (if compress?
    Minecraft::IO::Memory.new.tap do |buffer|
      size = packet_bytes.size

      if size > compression_threshold
        buffer.write(size.to_u32)

        Compress::Zlib::Writer.open(buffer) do |zlib|
          zlib.write(packet_bytes)
        end
      else
        buffer.write(0_u32)
        buffer.write(packet_bytes)
      end
    end.to_slice
  else
    packet_bytes
  end).try do |bytes_compressed|
    write_mutex.synchronize do
      io.write(bytes_compressed.size.to_u32)
      io.write(bytes_compressed)
      io.flush
    end
  end
rescue e
  disconnect("IO Error: #{e.message}")
  raise_without_backtrace(e)
end

instance_methods.doc: Get slot by absolute index in the container menu
instance_methods.summary: Get slot by absolute index in the container menu

def.body:
if index < 0
  raise(ArgumentError.new("Slot index cannot be negative"))
elsif index < @container_size
  @container_slots[index]
elsif index < total_slots
  player_index = index - @container_size



  if player_index < 27
    internal_index = player_index + 9
  else
    internal_index = player_index - 27
  end

  @player_inventory[internal_index]
else
  raise(ArgumentError.new("Slot index #{index} out of bounds for container with #{total_slots} slots"))
end

instance_methods.summary: Set slot by absolute index in the container menu

def.body:
if index < 0
  raise(ArgumentError.new("Slot index cannot be negative"))
elsif index < @container_size
  @container_slots[index] = slot
elsif index < total_slots
  player_index = index - @container_size



  if player_index < 27
    internal_index = player_index + 9
  else
    internal_index = player_index - 27
  end

  @player_inventory[internal_index] = slot
else
  raise(ArgumentError.new("Slot index #{index} out of bounds for container with #{total_slots} slots"))
end

def.name: update_all_slots
def.body:
log = Log.for("update_all_slots")


old_state_id = @state_id
@state_id = packet_state_id

log.debug do "Container update: id=#{@id}, state_id #{old_state_id}→#{packet_state_id}, #{slots.size} slots" end


container_slots = slots[0...@container_size]
update_container_slots(container_slots)



if slots.size > @container_size
  player_slots = slots[@container_size...slots.size]


  if player_slots.size == 36
    network_main_inventory = player_slots[0...27]
    network_hotbar = player_slots[27...36]


    @player_inventory.update_slots(network_hotbar, 0)
    @player_inventory.update_slots(network_main_inventory, 9)
  else
    log.warn do "Unexpected player inventory slot count: #{player_slots.size}, expected 36" end
    @player_inventory.update_slots(player_slots, 0)
  end
end

@cursor = cursor


slots.each_with_index do |slot, index|
  if index < @remote_slots.size
    @remote_slots[index].force(slot)
  end
end
@remote_cursor.force(cursor)

def.body:

size.times do |i|
  @container_slots[i] = slots[i]
end

types.name: CRC32C

constants.name: CRC32C_TABLE
constants.doc: CRC32C polynomial (Castagnoli)
constants.summary: CRC32C polynomial (Castagnoli)

types.doc: CRC32C implementation to match Minecraft's hashedslot hashing
types.summary: CRC32C implementation to match Minecraft's hashedslot hashing

def.name: checksum
def.body:
crc = ~0_u32
data.each do |byte|
  index = (crc ^ byte) & 255
  crc = (crc >> 8) ^ CRC32C_TABLE[index]
end
~crc

  DataComponents::ItemModel.read(io)
when 8
  DataComponents::Lore.read(io)
when 9
  DataComponents::Rarity.read(io)
when 10
  DataComponents::Enchantments.read(io)
when 13
  DataComponents::AttributeModifiers.read(io)
when 15
  DataComponents::TooltipDisplay.read(io)
when 16
  DataComponents::RepairCost.read(io)
when 27
  DataComponents::Enchantable.read(io)
when 17
  DataComponents::CreativeSlotLock.read(io)
when 18
  DataComponents::EnchantmentGlintOverride.read(io)
when 35
  DataComponents::DyedColor.read(io)
when 36
  DataComponents::MapColor.read(io)
when 37
  DataComponents::MapId.read(io)
when 39
  DataComponents::MapPostProcessing.read(io)
when 42
  DataComponents::PotionContents.read(io)
when 47
  DataComponents::Trim.read(io)
when 49
  DataComponents::EntityData.read(io)
when 63
  DataComponents::BannerPatterns.read(io)
when 26
  DataComponents::Weapon.read(io)
else
  raise("Unknown data component type: #{component_type}")
end

types.name: AttributeModifiers
types.doc: Component for attribute modifiers (complex structure)

def.name: read
def.body:
modifier_count = io.read_var_int
modifiers = Array(AttributeModifier).new
modifier_count.times do |_|


  attribute_id = io.read_var_int

  modifier_id = io.read_var_string
  value = io.read_double
  operation = io.read_var_int

  slot = io.read_var_int

  display = io.read_var_int

  modifiers << (AttributeModifier.new(attribute_id, modifier_id, value, operation, slot, display))
end

new(modifiers)

def.name: write
def.body:
io.write(modifiers.size)
modifiers.each do |modifier|

  io.write(modifier.attribute_id)
  io.write(modifier.modifier_id)
  io.write(modifier.value)
  io.write(modifier.operation)
  io.write(modifier.slot)
  io.write(modifier.display)
end

types.doc: Component for banner_patterns (Array of banner pattern layers)
types.summary: Component for banner_patterns (Array of banner pattern layers)

def.name: read
def.body:
layer_count = io.read_var_int
layers = Array(BannerPatternLayer).new
layer_count.times do
  pattern_type = io.read_var_int


  asset_id = nil
  translation_key = nil
  if pattern_type == 0
    asset_id = io.read_var_string
    translation_key = io.read_var_string
  end


  color = io.read_var_int

  layers << (BannerPatternLayer.new(pattern_type, asset_id, translation_key, color))
end
new(layers)

def.name: write
def.body:
io.write(layers.size)
layers.each do |layer|
  io.write(layer.pattern_type)


  if layer.pattern_type == 0
    io.write(layer.asset_id.not_nil!)
    io.write(layer.translation_key.not_nil!)
  end

  io.write(layer.color)
end

types.doc: Component for item_name (Text Component)

def.name: read
def.body:
lore_count = io.read_var_int
lore = Array(String).new
lore_count.times do
  nbt = io.read_nbt_unamed

  lore_text = case nbt
  when Minecraft::NBT::StringTag
    nbt.value
  when Minecraft::NBT::CompoundTag
    text = nbt["text"]?.try() do |__arg1| (__arg1.as(Minecraft::NBT::StringTag)).value end || ""
    extra_text = ""
    if extra = nbt["extra"]?
      if extra.is_a?(Minecraft::NBT::ListTag)
        extra.value.each do |item|
          if item.is_a?(Minecraft::NBT::CompoundTag)
            extra_text = extra_text + (item["text"]?.try() do |__arg2| (__arg2.as(Minecraft::NBT::StringTag)).value end || "")
          end
        end
      end
    end
    text + extra_text
  else
    "Unknown"
  end
  lore << lore_text
end
new(lore)

def.name: write
def.body:
io.write(lore.size)
lore.each do |text|

  text_component = TextComponent.new(text)
  text_component.write(io)
end

constructors.args_html: (has_potion_id : Bool = false, potion_id : UInt32 | Nil = nil, has_custom_color : Bool = false, custom_color : UInt32 | Nil = nil, custom_effects : Array(Rosegold::DataComponents::PotionContents::PotionEffect) = [] of PotionEffect, custom_name : String = "")

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(has_potion_id, potion_id, has_custom_color, custom_color, custom_effects, custom_name)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

def.name: read
def.body:
has_potion_id = io.read_bool
potion_id = has_potion_id ? io.read_var_int : nil

has_custom_color = io.read_bool
custom_color = has_custom_color ? io.read_int.to_u32 : nil


effects_count = io.read_var_int
custom_effects = [] of PotionEffect
effects_count.times do
  custom_effects << (PotionEffect.read(io))
end

custom_name = io.read_var_string

new(has_potion_id, potion_id, has_custom_color, custom_color, custom_effects, custom_name)

def.name: write
def.body:
io.write(has_potion_id?)
if has_potion_id?
  io.write(potion_id.not_nil!)
end

io.write(has_custom_color?)
if has_custom_color?
  io.write_full(custom_color.not_nil!)
end


io.write(custom_effects.size)
custom_effects.each do |effect|
  effect.write(io)
end

io.write(custom_name)

instance_methods.args_html: (x : Int32, y : Int32, z : Int32) : UInt16 | Nil

block_state(x, y, z)

instance_methods.name: raycast_entity
instance_methods.args_string: (start : Vec3d, look : Vec3d, max_distance : Float64) : Entity | Nil
instance_methods.args_html: (start : Vec3d, look : Vec3d, max_distance : Float64) : Entity | Nil

def.name: raycast_entity
def.body:
closest_entity = nil
closest_distance = Float64::INFINITY

ray_end = start + (look * max_distance)

entities.each_value do |entity|
  if entity.living?
  else
    next
  end

  bounding_box = entity.bounding_box
  distance = bounding_box.ray_intersection(start, ray_end)
  if distance.nil?
    next
  end

  if distance < closest_distance
    closest_entity = entity
    closest_distance = distance
  end
end

def.name: bounding_box
def.body:
if metadata = self.metadata
  half_width = metadata.width / 2.0

  min = Vec3d.new(position.x - half_width, position.y, position.z - half_width)
  max = Vec3d.new(position.x + half_width, position.y + metadata.height, position.z + half_width)

  AABBd.new(min, max)
else
  half_size = 0.5
  min = Vec3d.new(position.x - half_size, position.y, position.z - half_size)
  max = Vec3d.new(position.x + half_size, position.y + 1, position.z + half_size)

  AABBd.new(min, max)
end

  end
end

instance_methods.name: wait_for
instance_methods.doc:
Waits for an event, if timeout is given, it will return nil
if the timeout is reached before the event is emitted.
instance_methods.summary: Waits for an event, if timeout is given, it will return nil if the timeout is reached before the event is emitted.
instance_methods.args_string: (event_type : T.class, timeout : Time::Span | Nil = nil) forall T
instance_methods.args_html: (event_type : T.class, timeout : Time::Span | Nil = nil) forall T

def.name: wait_for
def.body:
ran_event = nil
time_start = Time.utc

once(event_type) do |event|
  ran_event = event
end

while !ran_event
  if timeout && (Time.utc - time_start) > timeout
    return nil
  end
  sleep(0.01.seconds)
end

ran_event

types.name: HashedSlot
types.doc: Hashed slot format used in ClickContainer packet
types.summary: Hashed slot format used in ClickContainer packet

def.name: from_slot
def.body:
if slot.empty?
  new(false)
else
  hashed_components = Hash(UInt32, UInt32).new
  slot.components_to_add.each do |component_type, component|
    component_buffer = Minecraft::IO::Memory.new
    component_buffer.write(component_type)
    component.write(component_buffer)
    component_data = component_buffer.to_slice
    crc32_hash = CRC32C.checksum(component_data)
    hashed_components[component_type] = crc32_hash
  end

  new(true, slot.item_id_int, slot.count, hashed_components, slot.components_to_remove)
end

def.name: write
def.body:
io.write(has_item?)
if has_item?
else
  return
end

io.write(item_id_int)
io.write(count)


io.write(components_to_add.size)
components_to_add.each do |component_type, hash|
  io.write(component_type)
  io.write_full(hash.to_u32)
end


io.write(components_to_remove.size)
components_to_remove.each do |component_type|
  io.write(component_type)
end

instance_methods.name: count
instance_methods.doc:
Returns the number of matching items in the player inventory (inventory + hotbar), or in the given slots range.

Example:
  inventory.count "diamond_pickaxe" # => 2
  inventory.count &.empty? # => 2
  inventory.count { |slot| slot.name == "diamond_pickaxe" && slot.efficiency >= 4 } # => 1
  inventory.count "stone", slots # => 5 (count in entire window including container)
instance_methods.summary: Returns the number of matching items in the player inventory (inventory + hotbar), or in the given slots range.

  inventory.deposit_at_least 5, &.empty? # => 1

def.name: pick
def.body:
if (main_hand.matches?(spec)) && !main_hand.needs_repair?
  return true
end


hotbar_with_indices = hotbar_slots.map_with_index do |slot, index| {slot, index} end
sorted_hotbar = hotbar_with_indices.sort_by do |slot_index_pair|
  slot = slot_index_pair[0]
  max_durability = slot.max_durability
  if max_durability > 0
    [slot.durability, -slot.count.to_i8]
  else
    [Int32::MAX, -slot.count.to_i8]
  end
end

sorted_hotbar.each do |slot_index_pair|
  slot, index = slot_index_pair
  if (slot.matches?(spec)) && !slot.needs_repair?
    client.player.hotbar_selection = index.to_u8
    return true
  end
end


(sort_by_durability_and_count(slots)).each do |slot|
  if (slot.matches?(spec)) && !slot.needs_repair?
    swap_hotbar(client.player.hotbar_selection, slot)
    return true
  end
end

false

instance_methods.name: refill_hand
instance_methods.doc:
Refills the main hand to its maximum stack size by manually combining stacks.
Only works when no container is open (player inventory only).
Returns the final quantity in the main hand after refilling.

Example:
  inventory.refill_hand # => 64 (if main hand was stone and got filled to max stack)
  inventory.refill_hand # => 32 (if only 32 items were available)
  inventory.refill_hand # => 0 (if main hand is empty)
instance_methods.summary: Refills the main hand to its maximum stack size by manually combining stacks.

def.name: refill_hand
def.body:
if @client.container_menu != @client.inventory_menu
  Log.warn do "Cannot refill hand while container is open" end
  return main_hand.count.to_i32
end


if main_hand.empty?
  return 0
end

target_item_id = main_hand.item_id_int
max_stack_size = main_hand.max_stack_size.to_i32

if main_hand.count.to_i32 >= max_stack_size
  return main_hand.count.to_i32
end


current_hotbar_selection = @client.player.hotbar_selection.to_i32


loop do
  if main_hand.count.to_i32 >= max_stack_size
    break
  end


  matching_slot = inventory.find do |slot|
    (slot.item_id_int == target_item_id) && slot.count > 0
  end
  if matching_slot
  else
    break
  end


  @client.inventory_menu.send_click(matching_slot.slot_number, 0, :shift)



  if main_hand.count.to_i32 >= max_stack_size
    break
  end
end


hotbar_slots_with_matching_items = [] of Int32
hotbar.each_with_index do |slot, index|

  if index == current_hotbar_selection
    next
  end


  if (slot.item_id_int == target_item_id) && slot.count > 0
    hotbar_slots_with_matching_items << slot.slot_number
  end
end


hotbar_slots_with_matching_items.each do |slot_number|
  if main_hand.count.to_i32 >= max_stack_size
    break
  end
  @client.inventory_menu.send_click(slot_number, 0, :shift)
end


loop do
  if main_hand.count.to_i32 >= max_stack_size
    break
  end


  matching_slot = inventory.find do |slot|
    (slot.item_id_int == target_item_id) && slot.count > 0
  end
  if matching_slot
  else
    break
  end


  @client.inventory_menu.send_click(matching_slot.slot_number, 0, :shift)
end

main_hand.count.to_i32

Ensures the player has at least `count` items of the specified type in their inventory.

If not enough items are present, attempts to withdraw more from a container.

  inventory.replenish 5, "diamond" # => 3 (if only 3 available)

def.name: can_stack?
def.body:
if slot1.empty? || slot2.empty?
  return false
end
if slot1.item_id_int != slot2.item_id_int
  return false
end
if slot1.components_to_add != slot2.components_to_add
  return false
end
if slot1.components_to_remove != slot2.components_to_remove
  return false
end

max_stack = [slot1.max_stack_size, slot2.max_stack_size].min
(slot1.count + slot2.count) <= max_stack

instance_methods.name: check_and_fix_desync
instance_methods.doc: Check for desync and request refresh if needed (vanilla-style recovery)
instance_methods.summary: Check for desync and request refresh if needed (vanilla-style recovery)

def.name: check_and_fix_desync
def.body:
has_desync = false


total_slots.times do |i|
  local_slot = self[i]
  remote_slot = @remote_slots[i]

  if !(remote_slot.matches?(local_slot))
    Log.debug do "Detected slot desync at index #{i}: local=#{local_slot}, remote=#{remote_slot.slot}" end
    has_desync = true
  end
end


if !(@remote_cursor.matches?(@cursor))
  Log.debug do "Detected cursor desync: local=#{@cursor}, remote=#{@remote_cursor.slot}" end
  has_desync = true
end

if has_desync
  Log.info do "Requesting resync due to detected desync" end
  request_resync
end

def.name: move_item_stack_to
def.body:
source_slot = self[source_index]

if source_slot.empty?
  return false
end

moved_any = false


max_source_stack = get_max_stack_size(source_slot)

if source_slot.count > 1 || max_source_stack > 1
  if reverse
    index = target_end - 1
    while index >= target_start && source_slot.count > 0
      target_slot = self[index]

      if !target_slot.empty? && (same_item_same_components?(source_slot, target_slot))
        max_stack = get_max_stack_size(target_slot)
        available_space = max_stack - target_slot.count.to_i
        transfer_amount = [source_slot.count.to_i, available_space].min

        if transfer_amount > 0
          target_slot.count = target_slot.count + transfer_amount.to_u32
          source_slot.count = source_slot.count - transfer_amount.to_u32
          moved_any = true
        end
      end
      index = index - 1
    end
  else
    index = target_start
    while index < target_end && source_slot.count > 0
      target_slot = self[index]

      if !target_slot.empty? && (same_item_same_components?(source_slot, target_slot))
        max_stack = get_max_stack_size(target_slot)
        available_space = max_stack - target_slot.count.to_i
        transfer_amount = [source_slot.count.to_i, available_space].min

        if transfer_amount > 0
          target_slot.count = target_slot.count + transfer_amount.to_u32
          source_slot.count = source_slot.count - transfer_amount.to_u32
          moved_any = true
        end
      end
      index = index + 1
    end
  end
end


if source_slot.count > 0
  if reverse
    index = target_end - 1
    while index >= target_start && source_slot.count > 0
      if self[index].empty? && (may_place?(index, source_slot))
        self[index] = copy_slot(source_slot)
        source_slot.count = 0_u32
        moved_any = true
        break
      end
      index = index - 1
    end
  else
    index = target_start
    while index < target_end && source_slot.count > 0
      if self[index].empty? && (may_place?(index, source_slot))
        self[index] = copy_slot(source_slot)
        source_slot.count = 0_u32
        moved_any = true
        break
      end
      index = index + 1
    end
  end
end


if source_slot.count == 0
  self[source_index] = Rosegold::Slot.new
end

moved_any

def.name: perform_drop_operation
def.body:
if slot_index >= 0 && @cursor.empty?
else
  return
end
if slot_index < total_slots
else
  return
end

source_slot = self[slot_index]
drop_amount = button == 0 ? 1 : source_slot.count.to_i


result = safe_take(slot_index, drop_amount)
if result
else

end

taken_item = result[:taken]
Log.debug do "DROP: Dropped #{taken_item.count}x #{taken_item.name || "unknown"} from slot #{slot_index}" end

instance_methods.name: perform_hotbar_swap
instance_methods.doc: Shared hotbar swap for click operations (identical validation logic)
instance_methods.summary: Shared hotbar swap for click operations (identical validation logic)

def.name: perform_hotbar_swap
def.body:
if ((slot_index < 0 || slot_index >= total_slots) || button < 0) || button >= 9
  return
end

hotbar_slot_index = hotbar_slot_index(button.to_i32)
if hotbar_slot_index >= total_slots
  return
end

slot_item = self[slot_index]
hotbar_item = self[hotbar_slot_index]


can_place_slot_in_hotbar = hotbar_item.empty? || (may_place?(hotbar_slot_index, slot_item))
can_place_hotbar_in_slot = slot_item.empty? || (may_place?(slot_index, hotbar_item))

can_pickup_from_slot = slot_item.empty? || (may_pickup?(slot_index))
can_pickup_from_hotbar = hotbar_item.empty? || (may_pickup?(hotbar_slot_index))


if ((can_place_slot_in_hotbar && can_place_hotbar_in_slot) && can_pickup_from_slot) && can_pickup_from_hotbar
  temp = copy_slot(slot_item)
  self[slot_index] = copy_slot(hotbar_item)
  self[hotbar_slot_index] = temp
end

self[offhand_index] = temp

instance_methods.name: perform_regular_click
instance_methods.doc: Shared regular click operation (identical vanilla logic in both menus)
instance_methods.summary: Shared regular click operation (identical vanilla logic in both menus)

def.name: perform_regular_click
def.body:
if slot_index < 0 || slot_index >= total_slots
  return
end

clicked_slot = self[slot_index]
cursor_slot = @cursor
is_primary = button == 0


if clicked_slot.empty?
  if !cursor_slot.empty? && (may_place?(slot_index, cursor_slot))
    amount_to_place = is_primary ? cursor_slot.count.to_i : 1
    @cursor = safe_insert(slot_index, cursor_slot, amount_to_place)
  end
elsif cursor_slot.empty?
  if may_pickup?(slot_index)
    amount_to_take = is_primary ? clicked_slot.count.to_i : (clicked_slot.count.to_i + 1) // 2
    take_result = safe_take(slot_index, amount_to_take)
    if take_result
      @cursor = take_result[:taken]
      self[slot_index] = take_result[:remaining_slot]
    end
  end
elsif may_pickup?(slot_index)
  if may_place?(slot_index, cursor_slot)
    if same_item_same_components?(clicked_slot, cursor_slot)
      amount_to_merge = is_primary ? cursor_slot.count.to_i : 1
      @cursor = safe_insert(slot_index, cursor_slot, amount_to_merge)
    elsif cursor_slot.count <= (get_slot_max_stack_size(slot_index, cursor_slot)).to_u32
      temp = copy_slot(clicked_slot)
      self[slot_index] = copy_slot(cursor_slot)
      @cursor = temp
    end
  elsif same_item_same_components?(clicked_slot, cursor_slot)
    max_cursor_size = get_max_stack_size(cursor_slot)
    available_space = max_cursor_size - cursor_slot.count.to_i
    amount_to_take = [clicked_slot.count.to_i, available_space].min

    if amount_to_take > 0
      take_result = safe_take(slot_index, amount_to_take)
      if take_result
        cursor_slot.count = cursor_slot.count + take_result[:taken].count
        self[slot_index] = take_result[:remaining_slot]
      end
    end
  end
end

instance_methods.name: safe_insert
instance_methods.doc: Vanilla's safeInsert equivalent - safely insert items from cursor to slot
instance_methods.summary: Vanilla's safeInsert equivalent - safely insert items from cursor to slot

def.name: safe_insert
def.body:
if cursor_slot.empty? || (!(may_place?(target_slot_index, cursor_slot)))
  return cursor_slot
end

target_slot = self[target_slot_index]
max_stack_size = get_slot_max_stack_size(target_slot_index, cursor_slot)


transfer_amount = [amount, cursor_slot.count.to_i, max_stack_size - target_slot.count.to_i].min
if transfer_amount <= 0
  return cursor_slot
end

if target_slot.empty?
  new_target = copy_slot(cursor_slot)
  new_target.count = transfer_amount.to_u32
  self[target_slot_index] = new_target


  cursor_slot.count = cursor_slot.count - transfer_amount.to_u32
  cursor_slot.count == 0 ? Rosegold::Slot.new : cursor_slot
elsif same_item_same_components?(target_slot, cursor_slot)
  target_slot.count = target_slot.count + transfer_amount.to_u32
  cursor_slot.count = cursor_slot.count - transfer_amount.to_u32
  cursor_slot.count == 0 ? Rosegold::Slot.new : cursor_slot
else
  cursor_slot
end

instance_methods.name: safe_take
instance_methods.doc: Vanilla's tryRemove/safeTake equivalent - safely take items from slot
instance_methods.summary: Vanilla's tryRemove/safeTake equivalent - safely take items from slot

def.name: safe_take
def.body:
source_slot = self[source_slot_index]


if !(may_pickup?(source_slot_index))
  return nil
end


if (!(allow_modification?(source_slot_index))) && amount < source_slot.count.to_i
  return nil
end

if source_slot.empty?
  return nil
end

actual_amount = [amount, source_slot.count.to_i].min
if actual_amount == 0
  return nil
end


taken = copy_slot(source_slot)
taken.count = actual_amount.to_u32


if actual_amount >= source_slot.count.to_i
  self[source_slot_index] = Rosegold::Slot.new
else
  source_slot.count = source_slot.count - actual_amount.to_u32
end

{taken: taken, remaining_slot: self[source_slot_index]}

instance_methods.name: send_click
instance_methods.doc: Send container click packet with vanilla client-side logic
instance_methods.summary: Send container click packet with vanilla client-side logic

def.name: send_click
def.body:
mode = case click_type
when :click
  Serverbound::ClickWindow::Mode::Click
when :shift
  Serverbound::ClickWindow::Mode::Shift
when :swap
  Serverbound::ClickWindow::Mode::Swap
when :middle
  Serverbound::ClickWindow::Mode::Middle
when :drop
  Serverbound::ClickWindow::Mode::Drop
when :drag
  Serverbound::ClickWindow::Mode::Drag
when :double
  Serverbound::ClickWindow::Mode::Double
else
  Serverbound::ClickWindow::Mode::Click
end


before_slots = Array.new(total_slots) do |i|
  copy_slot(self[i])
end


if slot_index == -999
  perform_cursor_drop_operation(button)
elsif (click_type == (:swap)) && (button == 40)
  perform_offhand_swap_operation(slot_index)
else
  case click_type
  when :shift
    perform_shift_click(slot_index)
  when :click
    perform_regular_click(slot_index, button)
  when :swap
    perform_hotbar_swap(slot_index, button)
  when :drop
    perform_drop_operation(slot_index, button)
  end
end


changed_slots = [] of Rosegold::WindowSlot
total_slots.times do |i|
  before_slot = before_slots[i]
  after_slot = self[i]
  if !(slots_match?(before_slot, after_slot))
    changed_slots << (Rosegold::WindowSlot.new(i, after_slot))
  end
end


cursor_slot = @cursor


packet = Serverbound::ClickWindow.new(mode, button.to_i8, slot_index.to_i16, changed_slots, menu_id, increment_state_id.to_i32, cursor_slot)
@client.send_packet!(packet)

instance_methods.summary: Helper method to compare if two slots are equivalent (vanilla's ItemStack.matches equivalent)

def.name: slots_match?
def.body:
if slot1.empty? && slot2.empty?
  return true
end
if slot1.empty? != slot2.empty?
  return false
end

(
  (
    (slot1.item_id_int == slot2.item_id_int) &&
    (slot1.count == slot2.count)
  ) &&
  (slot1.components_to_add == slot2.components_to_add)
) &&
(slot1.components_to_remove == slot2.components_to_remove)

instance_methods.doc: Shared hotbar swap operation with abstracted slot calculations
instance_methods.summary: Shared hotbar swap operation with abstracted slot calculations

def.name: swap_hotbar
def.body:
if ((slot_number < 0 || slot_number >= total_slots) || hotbar_nr < 0) || hotbar_nr >= 9
  return
end


before_slots = Array.new(total_slots) do |i|
  copy_slot(self[i])
end


hotbar_slot_index = hotbar_slot_index(hotbar_nr.to_i32)
if hotbar_slot_index >= 0 && hotbar_slot_index < total_slots
  current_slot = self[slot_number]
  hotbar_slot = self[hotbar_slot_index]
  self[slot_number] = hotbar_slot
  self[hotbar_slot_index] = current_slot
end


changed_slots = [] of Rosegold::WindowSlot
total_slots.times do |i|
  before_slot = before_slots[i]
  after_slot = self[i]
  if !(slots_match?(before_slot, after_slot))
    changed_slots << (Rosegold::WindowSlot.new(i, after_slot))
  end
end


packet = Serverbound::ClickWindow.new(Serverbound::ClickWindow::Mode::Swap, hotbar_nr.to_i8, slot_number.to_i16, changed_slots, menu_id, increment_state_id.to_i32, @cursor)

@client.send_packet!(packet)

types.name: Look
types.doc:
The unit circle of yaw on the XZ-plane has 0° at (0, 1), 90° at (-1, 0), 180° at (0, -1) and 270° at (1, 0).

Yaw is not clamped to between 0° and 360°; any number is valid, including negative numbers and numbers greater than 360°.

Pitch 0 is looking straight ahead, -90° is looking straight up, and 90° is looking straight down.

There are an infinite number of "down"/"up" looks with different yaw; use e.g. `NORTH.down`.
types.summary: The unit circle of yaw on the XZ-plane has 0° at (0, 1), 90° at (-1, 0), 180° at (0, -1) and 270° at (1, 0).

def.name: from_rad
def.body:
yaw = (yaw_rad * 360) / Math::TAU
pitch = (pitch_rad * 360) / Math::TAU
Look.new(yaw.to_f32, pitch.to_f32)

def.name: from_vec
def.body:
yaw_rad = Math.atan2(-vec.x, vec.z)
ground_distance = Math.sqrt((vec.x * vec.x) + (vec.z * vec.z))
pitch_rad = -(Math.atan2(vec.y, ground_distance))

Look.from_rad(yaw_rad.to_f32, pitch_rad.to_f32)
